edu.isr.data

Class Schemes

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.isr.data.Schemes

  • class Schemes
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the weighting schemes. Each scheme defines the importance of each instance based on a distance notion.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Schemes()

      Weigh an instance based on the deviation from a hyper-plane passing as close as possible to the instance and its neighbors.
      private static double proximity(Instance inst, java.lang.String scheme, double distMetric, double[] p, int numDim)
      Weigh an instance based on the proximity to the k nearest neighbors in the input or in the input-output space, defined as the average distance from the instance to its k nearest neighbors.
      private static double surrounding(Instance inst, java.lang.String scheme, double distMetric, double[] p, int numDim)
      Weigh an instance based on the surrounding by the k nearest neighbors in the input or in the input-output space, defined as the length of the average of the vectors pointing at the nearest neighbors.

    • Method Detail

      • findWeight

        static double findWeight(Instance inst,
                         ParametersManager params,
                         java.lang.String scheme)
        Find the weight of a specific instance.
        Parameters:
        inst - The instance to be weighted.
        params - Experiment parameters.
        scheme - Weighting scheme. If the parameter "scheme" in the parameter file is "remoteness-x" or "remoteness-xy", this method will be alternately called with the corresponding proximity and surrounding schemes.
        Returns:
        The weight.

      • proximity

        private static double proximity(Instance inst,
                                java.lang.String scheme,
                                double distMetric,
                                double[] p,
                                int numDim)
        Weigh an instance based on the proximity to the k nearest neighbors in the input or in the input-output space, defined as the average distance from the instance to its k nearest neighbors.
        Parameters:
        inst - The instance to be weighted.
        scheme - Weighting scheme. If the parameter "scheme" in the parameter file is "remoteness-x" or "remoteness-xy", this method will be alternately called with the corresponding proximity and surrounding schemes.
        distMetric - Parameter of the parameterized Minkowski metric. For example, z = 1 means Manhattan distance and z = 2 means Euclidean distance. If z < 1, then we have the so called fractional distance.
        p - Source vector (corresponding to the instance for which we want to find the weights).
        numDim - Number of dimensions (input or input + output, depending on the weighting scheme).
        Returns:
        The weight based on the proximity scheme.

      • surrounding

        private static double surrounding(Instance inst,
                                  java.lang.String scheme,
                                  double distMetric,
                                  double[] p,
                                  int numDim)
        Weigh an instance based on the surrounding by the k nearest neighbors in the input or in the input-output space, defined as the length of the average of the vectors pointing at the nearest neighbors.
        Parameters:
        inst - The instance to be weighted.
        scheme - Weighting scheme. If the parameter "scheme" in the parameter file is "remoteness-x" or "remoteness-xy", this method will be alternately called with the corresponding proximity and surrounding schemes.
        distMetric - Parameter of the parameterized Minkowski metric. For example, z = 1 means Manhattan distance and z = 2 means Euclidean distance. If z < 1, then we have the so called fractional distance.
        p - Origin of the vectors (corresponding to the instance for which we want to find the weights).
        numDim - Number of dimensions (input or input + output, depending on the weighting scheme).
        Returns:
        The weight based on the surrounding scheme.

      • nonLinearity

        private static double nonLinearity(Instance inst)
        Weigh an instance based on the deviation from a hyper-plane passing as close as possible to the instance and its neighbors.
        Parameters:
        inst - The instance to be weighted.
        Returns:
        The weight based on the nonlinearity scheme.

      • getNeighborPos

        private static double[] getNeighborPos(Instance neighbor,
                                       java.lang.String scheme)
        Get the neighbor position. The number of dimensions is based on the weighting scheme.
        Parameters:
        neighbor - Current neighbor of the instance of which we want to weigh.
        scheme - Weighting scheme.
        Returns:
        The neighbor vector.
